geneSummary: CTNNB1 (β-catenin), a transcriptional activator, is recurrently mutated in various cancers including endometrial and hepatocellular cancers.

mutationEffect.description: The CTNNB1 G34E mutation is located in the N-terminus of the protein. This mutation has been found in brain cancer and is a statistically significant hotspot (PMID: 16258095, 17172831). While this mutation has not yet been functionally characterized, hepatocellular tumor samples harboring this mutation demonstrated increased expression of the protein compared to normal liver samples (PMID: 9635572).

variantSummary: The CTNNB1 G34E mutation is likely oncogenic.
